greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array:  the fusion of polynomial sequences P and Q given by p(n,x)=(2x+1)^n and q(n,x)=x^n+x^(n-1)+...+x+1.
comment: See A193722 for the definition of fusion of two sequences of polynomials or triangular arrays.
formula: T(n,k) = sum {i = 0..k} binomial(n-1,k-i)*2^(k-i) for 0 <= k <= n.
For n >= 1, the n-th row polynomial R(n,x) = 1/(x-1)*( 3^(n-1)*x^(n+1) - (2*x + 1)^(n-1) ). (End)
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Coefficient[p[n, x], x^k]; t[n_, 0] := p[n, x] /. x -> 0;
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 06 2011
